title.zh: 《田敬仲完世家》 House of Tian Jingzhong
title.raw: 《田敬仲完世家》 House of Tian Jingzhong

sentences.zh: 陳完者，陳厲公他之子也。

translations.literal: Chen Wan was the son of Chen Li Gong Ta.
translations.idiomatic: Chen Wan was the son of Duke Li of Chen, whose name was Ta.

sentences.zh: 完生，周太史過陳，陳厲公使卜完，卦得觀之否：「是為觀國之光，利用賓于王。

translations.literal: Wan born, Zhou Grand Historian passed Chen, Chen Li Gong made divine Wan, hexagram got Guan Zhi Pi: 'This observe state light, beneficial guest king.
translations.idiomatic: When Wan was born, the Zhou Grand Historian passed through Chen. Chen Li Gong had him divined, and the hexagram was Guan Zhi Pi: 'This is the light of observing the state, beneficial to be a guest of the king.'

sentences.zh: 此其代陳有國乎？

translations.literal: This his replace Chen have state?
translations.idiomatic: Will he replace Chen and have the state?

sentences.zh: 不在此而在異國乎？

translations.literal: Not in this but in different country?
translations.idiomatic: Not in this place but in a different country?

sentences.zh: 非此其身也，在其子孫。

translations.literal: Not in his own person, but in his descendants.
translations.idiomatic: It would not be in his own lifetime, but in his descendants.

sentences.zh: 若在異國，必姜姓。

translations.literal: If in a different country, it must be the Jiang surname.
translations.idiomatic: If in another state, it must be the Jiang surname.

sentences.zh: 姜姓，四嶽之後。

translations.literal: The Jiang surname are descendants of the Four Peaks.
translations.idiomatic: The Jiang surname came from the descendants of the Four Peaks.

sentences.zh: 物莫能兩大，陳衰，此其昌乎？」

translations.literal: Things cannot two great, Chen decline, this his flourish?'
translations.idiomatic: Things cannot be two great. Chen declines, will this flourish?'

translations.literal: Chen Wan was a son of Duke Li of Chen, whose name was Ta. When Wan was born, Zhou's Grand Historian passed through Chen, and Duke Li of Chen had him divine Wan's fortune; the hexagram was Guan with Pi: 'This is the light that illuminates the kingdom, beneficial to be a guest of the king. Will this be his replacement of Chen possessing the state? Not in this land but in a foreign country? Not in his own person, but in his descendants. If in a foreign country, it must be the Jiang surname. The Jiang surname are descendants of the Four Peaks. No thing can be great in two places; Chen declines, will this flourish?'

sentences.zh: 厲公者，陳文公少子也，其母蔡女。

translations.literal: Li Gong was Chen Wen Gong's younger son, his mother was a Cai woman.
translations.idiomatic: Duke Li was the youngest son of Duke Wen of Chen, and his mother was a woman from Cai.

sentences.zh: 文公卒，厲公兄鮑立，是為桓公。

translations.literal: Wen Gong died, and Li Gong's brother Bao was established, called Huan Gong.
translations.idiomatic: When Duke Wen died, Duke Li's brother Bao ascended the throne. He became Duke Huan.

sentences.zh: 桓公與他異母。

translations.literal: Huan Gong and Ta had different mothers.
translations.idiomatic: Duke Huan and Ta had different mothers.

sentences.zh: 及桓公病，蔡人為他殺桓公鮑及太子免而立他，為厲公。

translations.literal: When Huan Gong fell ill, the Cai people killed Huan Gong Bao and crown prince Mian for Ta and established Ta, who became Li Gong.
translations.idiomatic: When Duke Huan fell ill, people from Cai assassinated Duke Huan Bao and Crown Prince Mian on Ta's behalf, establishing Ta as Duke Li.

sentences.zh: 厲公既立，娶蔡女。

translations.literal: After Li Gong was established, he married a Cai woman.
translations.idiomatic: After Duke Li ascended the throne, he married a woman from Cai.

sentences.zh: 蔡女淫於蔡人，數歸，厲公亦數如蔡。

translations.literal: The Cai woman was licentious with a Cai man, frequently returning home. Li Gong also frequently went to Cai.
translations.idiomatic: The Cai woman was licentious with a man from Cai, returning home frequently. Duke Li also frequently went to Cai.

sentences.zh: 桓公之少子林怨厲公殺其父與兄，乃令蔡人誘厲公而殺之。

translations.literal: Huan Gong's younger son Lin resented Li Gong for killing his father and brother, so he ordered the Cai people to lure Li Gong and kill him.
translations.idiomatic: Duke Huan's youngest son Lin resented Duke Li for killing his father and brother, so he had people from Cai lure Duke Li and assassinate him.

sentences.zh: 林自立，是為莊公。

translations.literal: Lin established himself, called Zhuang Gong.
translations.idiomatic: Lin established himself as duke. He became Duke Zhuang.

sentences.zh: 故陳完不得立，為陳大夫。

translations.literal: Thus Chen Wan was not able to be established as ruler and became a grand master of Chen.
translations.idiomatic: Therefore Chen Wan could not establish himself as ruler, becoming a high official of Chen.

sentences.zh: 厲公之殺，以淫出國，故《春秋》曰「蔡人殺陳他」，罪之也。

translations.literal: Li Gong killed, because licentious left state, thus Spring and Autumn Annals said 'Cai people killed Chen Ta', blaming him.
translations.idiomatic: Li Gong was killed because he left the state due to licentiousness. Thus the Spring and Autumn Annals says 'Cai people killed Chen Ta', blaming him.

translations.literal: Duke Li was the youngest son of Duke Wen of Chen, his mother a woman of Cai. When Duke Wen died, Duke Li's brother Bao ascended, becoming Duke Huan. Duke Huan and Ta had different mothers. When Duke Huan fell ill, Cai people killed Duke Huan Bao and Crown Prince Mian on Ta's behalf and established Ta, making him Duke Li. Once Duke Li was established, he married a Cai woman. The Cai woman was licentious with Cai men, frequently returning home, and Duke Li also frequently went to Cai. Duke Huan's youngest son Lin resented Duke Li for killing his father and brother, so he had Cai people lure Duke Li and kill him. Lin established himself, becoming Duke Zhuang. Therefore Chen Wan could not establish himself and became a grandee of Chen. Duke Li's killing resulted from licentiousness abroad, therefore the Spring and Autumn Annals says 'Cai people killed Chen Ta' to condemn it.

sentences.zh: 莊公卒，立弟杵臼，是為宣公。

translations.literal: Zhuang Gong died, and younger brother Chu Jiu was established, called Xuan Gong.
translations.idiomatic: Duke Zhuang died, establishing his younger brother Chu Jiu as duke. He became Duke Xuan.

sentences.zh: 宣公［二］十一年，殺其太子御寇。

translations.literal: In Xuan Gong's twenty-first year, he killed his crown prince Yu Kou.
translations.idiomatic: In Duke Xuan's twenty-first year, he killed his crown prince Yu Kou.

sentences.zh: 御寇與完相愛，恐禍及己，完故奔齊。

translations.literal: Yu Kou and Wan were mutually friendly. Fearing calamity would reach themselves, Wan thus fled to Qi.
translations.idiomatic: Yu Kou and Wan were on good terms. Fearing calamity would extend to himself, Wan therefore fled to Qi.

sentences.zh: 齊桓公欲使為卿，辭曰：「羈旅之臣幸得免負檐，君之惠也，不敢當高位。」

translations.literal: Qi Huan Gong desired make minister, declined said: 'Sojourning minister fortunate escape carrying eaves, jun grace, not dare accept high position.'
translations.idiomatic: Qi Huan Gong desired to make him a minister. He declined, saying: 'This sojourning minister is fortunate to escape carrying the eaves. It is the jun's grace. I do not dare accept a high position.'

sentences.zh: 桓公使為工正。

translations.literal: Huan Gong made him Gong Zheng.
translations.idiomatic: Duke Huan had him serve as Director of Works.

sentences.zh: 齊懿仲欲妻完，卜之，占曰：「是謂鳳皇于蜚，和鳴鏘鏘。

translations.literal: Qi Yi Zhong desired wife Wan, divined it, interpretation said: 'This called phoenix fly, harmonious call clang clang.
translations.idiomatic: Qi Yi Zhong desired to give his daughter in marriage to Wan. He divined it, and the interpretation said: 'This is called phoenix in flight, harmonious calls clang clang.'

sentences.zh: 有媯之後，將育于姜。

translations.literal: There are descendants of Gui, who will be nurtured among the Jiang.
translations.idiomatic: Having descendants of the Jiang clan, they would flourish under the Jiang surname.

sentences.zh: 五世其昌，并于正卿。

translations.literal: In five generations he will flourish, equaling the proper ministers.
translations.idiomatic: Five generations and they would prosper, rising to the rank of chief minister.

sentences.zh: 八世之後，莫之與京。」

translations.literal: Eight generations after, none rival Jing.'
translations.idiomatic: After eight generations, none will rival Jing.'

sentences.zh: 卒妻完。

translations.literal: He finally married Wan.
translations.idiomatic: He died and married Wan to his wife.

sentences.zh: 完之奔齊，齊桓公立十四年矣。

translations.literal: When Wan fled to Qi, Qi Huan Gong had already been established for fourteen years.
translations.idiomatic: When Wan fled to Qi, Duke Huan of Qi had been established for fourteen years.

translations.literal: Duke Zhuang died and his younger brother Chu Jiu ascended, becoming Duke Xuan. In the twenty-first year of Duke Xuan, he killed his crown prince Yu Kou. Yu Kou with Wan mutually loved, feared disaster reach self, Wan thus fled Qi. Qi Huan Gong wished make him minister, declined said: 'Sojourning minister fortunate get avoid burden eave, lord favor, not dare receive high position.' Huan Gong made him work overseer. Qi Yi Zhong wished marry Wan, divined it, omen said: 'This called phoenix fly, harmonious cry clang clang. Have Gui after, will nurture at Jiang. Five generations its prosper, equal to proper ministers. Eight generations after, none rival capital.' Finally married Wan. Wan fled Qi, Qi Huan Gong established fourteen years.

sentences.zh: 完卒，謚為敬仲。

translations.literal: Wan died and was given the posthumous name Jing Zhong.
translations.idiomatic: Wan died, receiving the posthumous name Jing Zhong.

sentences.zh: 仲生稚孟夷。

translations.literal: Zhong gave birth to Zhi Meng Yi.
translations.idiomatic: Zhong gave birth to Zhi Meng Yi.

sentences.zh: 敬仲之如齊，以陳字為田氏。

translations.literal: When Jing Zhong came to Qi, he took the character Chen and became the Tian clan.
translations.idiomatic: Jing Zhong went to Qi, changing the Chen character to Tian clan.

translations.literal: Wan died, posthumous name Jing Zhong. Zhong gave birth Zhi Meng Yi. Jing Zhong enter Qi, with Chen character became Tian clan.

sentences.zh: 田稚孟夷生湣孟莊，田湣孟莊生文子須無。

translations.literal: Tian Zhi Meng Yi gave birth to Min Meng Zhuang. Tian Min Meng Zhuang gave birth to Wen Zi Xu Wu.
translations.idiomatic: Tian Zhi Meng Yi gave birth to Min Meng Zhuang, Tian Min Meng Zhuang gave birth to Wen Zi Xu Wu.

sentences.zh: 田文子事齊莊公。

translations.literal: Tian Wen Zi served Qi Zhuang Gong.
translations.idiomatic: Tian Wen Zi served Duke Zhuang of Qi.

translations.literal: Tian Zhi Meng Yi gave birth Min Meng Zhuang, Tian Min Meng Zhuang gave birth Wen Zi Xu Wu. Tian Wen Zi served Qi Zhuang Gong.

sentences.zh: 晉之大夫欒逞作亂於晉，來奔齊，齊莊公厚客之。

translations.literal: The Jin grand master Luan Ying made rebellion in Jin and came fleeing to Qi. Qi Zhuang Gong generously hosted him.
translations.idiomatic: A high official of Jin, Luan Ying, created disorder in Jin and came fleeing to Qi. Duke Zhuang of Qi treated him generously as a guest.

sentences.zh: 晏嬰與田文子諫，莊公弗聽。

translations.literal: Yan Ying and Tian Wen Zi advised, but Zhuang Gong would not listen.
translations.idiomatic: Yan Ying and Tian Wen Zi advised against it, but Duke Zhuang did not listen.

translations.literal: Jin grand master Luan Ying made chaos at Jin, came fled Qi, Qi Zhuang Gong thick guest him. Yan Ying with Tian Wen Zi advised, Zhuang Gong not listened.

sentences.zh: 文子卒，生桓子無宇。

translations.literal: Wen Zi died and gave birth to Huan Zi Wu Yu.
translations.idiomatic: Wen Zi died, giving birth to Zhuang Zi Wu Yu.

sentences.zh: 田桓子無宇有力，事齊莊公，甚有寵。

translations.literal: Tian Huan Zi Wu Yu had strength. He served Qi Zhuang Gong and was very favored.
translations.idiomatic: Tian Zhuang Zi Wu Yu was capable, serving Duke Zhuang of Qi, and was greatly favored.

translations.literal: Wen Zi died, gave birth Huan Zi Wu Yu. Tian Huan Zi Wu Yu had strength, served Qi Zhuang Gong, very favored.

sentences.zh: 無宇卒，生武子開與釐子乞。

translations.literal: Wu Yu died and gave birth to Wu Zi Kai and Xi Zi Qi.
translations.idiomatic: Wu Yu died, giving birth to Wu Zi Kai and Xi Zi Qi.

sentences.zh: 田釐子乞事齊景公為大夫，其收賦稅於民以小斗受之，其（粟）［稟］予民以大斗，行陰德於民，而景公弗禁。

translations.literal: Tian Xi Zi Qi served Qi Jing Gong as grand master. He collected taxes from the people using small measures but gave to the people using large measures. He practiced hidden virtue on the people, and Jing Gong did not prohibit it.
translations.idiomatic: Tian Xi Zi Qi served Duke Jing of Qi as high official. He collected taxes from the people using small measures to receive, but granted to the people using large measures, performing hidden virtue among the people. Duke Jing did not prohibit it.

sentences.zh: 由此田氏得齊眾心，宗族益彊，民思田氏。

translations.literal: From this the Tian clan obtained the hearts of many in Qi. The clan became increasingly strong, and the people thought of the Tian clan.
translations.idiomatic: From this the Tian clan won the people's hearts. Their clan and lineage grew increasingly powerful, and the people longed for the Tian clan.

sentences.zh: 晏子數諫景公，景公弗聽。

translations.literal: Yan Zi advised Jing Gong several times, but Jing Gong would not listen.
translations.idiomatic: Yan Zi frequently advised Duke Jing, but Duke Jing did not listen.

sentences.zh: 已而使於晉，與叔向私語曰：「齊國之政卒歸於田氏矣。」

translations.literal: Then envoy to Jin, with Shu Xiang private conversation said: 'Qi state governance finally belongs to Tian clan.'
translations.idiomatic: Then he was envoy to Jin and had a private conversation with Shu Xiang, saying: 'Qi state's governance has finally come to belong to the Tian clan.'

translations.literal: Wu Yu died, gave birth Wu Zi Kai with Xi Zi Qi. Tian Xi Zi Qi served Qi Jing Gong as grand master, his collected taxes from people with small dou received, his granted people with big dou, practiced hidden virtue on people, yet Jing Gong not forbade. From this the Tian clan won the hearts of the Qi multitudes, their clansmen grew stronger, and the people thought of the Tian clan. Master Yan repeatedly admonished Duke Jing, but Duke Jing would not listen. Later when he was sent to Jin, he privately spoke with Shu Xiang: 'The governance of Qi will ultimately return to the Tian clan.'

sentences.zh: 晏嬰卒後，范、中行氏反晉。

translations.literal: After Yan Ying died, the Fan and Zhong Hang clans rebelled against Jin.
translations.idiomatic: After Yan Ying died, the Fan and Zhonghang clans rebelled against Jin.

sentences.zh: 晉攻之急，范、中行請粟於齊。

translations.literal: Jin's attack was urgent, so the Fan and Zhong Hang clans requested grain from Qi.
translations.idiomatic: Jin attacked them urgently. The Fan and Zhonghang clans requested grain from Qi.

sentences.zh: 田乞欲為亂，樹黨於諸侯，乃說景公曰：「范、中行數有德於齊，齊不可不救。」

translations.literal: Tian Qi desired make rebellion, establish faction among feudal lords, thus persuaded Jing Gong said: 'Fan, Zhong Hang several times had virtue toward Qi, Qi cannot not save.'
translations.idiomatic: Tian Qi desired to make rebellion and establish factions among the feudal lords. Thus he persuaded Jing Gong, saying: 'The Fan and Zhong Hang clans have several times shown virtue toward Qi. Qi cannot fail to save them.'

sentences.zh: 齊使田乞救之而輸之粟。

translations.literal: Qi sent Tian Qi to save them and transported grain.
translations.idiomatic: Qi sent Tian Qi to rescue them and transport grain to them.

translations.literal: After Yan Ying died, the Fan and Zhong Xing clans rebelled against Jin. Jin attacked them urgently, and the Fan and Zhong Xing clans requested grain from Qi. Tian Qi desired to create disorder and establish partisans among the feudal lords, so he persuaded Duke Jing: 'The Fan and Zhong Xing clans have repeatedly shown virtue toward Qi, Qi cannot fail to save them.' Qi sent Tian Qi to save them and transport grain to them.

sentences.zh: 景公太子死，後有寵姬曰芮子，生子荼。

translations.literal: Jing Gong's crown prince died. Later he had a favored concubine called Rui Zi, who gave birth to a son named Tu.
translations.idiomatic: Duke Jing's crown prince died. Later he favored a concubine named Rui Zi, who gave birth to Zi Chu.

sentences.zh: 景公病，命其相國惠子與高昭子以子荼為太子。

translations.literal: Jing Gong fell ill and ordered his chancellor Hui Zi and Gao Zhao Zi to make Zi Tu the crown prince.
translations.idiomatic: Duke Jing fell ill, commanding his chief ministers Guo Zi Hui and Gao Zhao Zi to establish Zi Chu as crown prince.

sentences.zh: 景公卒，兩相高、國立荼，是為晏孺子。

translations.literal: Jing Gong died. The two chancellors Gao and Guo established Tu, called Yan Ru Zi.
translations.idiomatic: Duke Jing died. The two chief ministers Gao and Guo established Chu. He became Duke Shao.

sentences.zh: 而田乞不說，欲立景公他子陽生。

translations.literal: But Tian Qi was not pleased and desired to establish Jing Gong's other son Yang Sheng.
translations.idiomatic: Tian Qi was displeased, wishing to establish Duke Jing's other son Yang Sheng.

sentences.zh: 陽生素與乞歡。

translations.literal: Yang Sheng had originally been friendly with Qi.
translations.idiomatic: Yang Sheng had always been on good terms with Qi.

sentences.zh: 晏孺子之立也，陽生奔魯。

translations.literal: When Yan Ru Zi was established, Yang Sheng fled to Lu.
translations.idiomatic: When Duke Shao was established, Yang Sheng fled to Lu.

sentences.zh: 田乞偽事高昭子、國惠子者，每朝代參乘，言曰：「始諸大夫不欲立孺子。

translations.literal: Tian Qi falsely served Gao Zhao Zi, Guo Hui Zi, every morning alternated second rider, said: 'Originally grand masters not desire establish Ru Zi.
translations.idiomatic: Tian Qi falsely served Gao Zhao Zi and Guo Hui Zi. Every morning he alternated as second rider and said: 'Originally the grand masters did not desire to establish Ru Zi.'

sentences.zh: 孺子既立，君相之，大夫皆自危，謀作亂。」

translations.literal: Ru Zi already established, jun assist him, grand masters all self endanger, plan make rebellion.'
translations.idiomatic: Ru Zi has already been established. The jun assists him. The grand masters all endanger themselves and plan to make rebellion.'

sentences.zh: 又紿大夫曰：「高昭子可畏也，及未發先之。」

translations.literal: Moreover deceived grand masters said: 'Gao Zhao Zi fearful, take before not send strike first.'
translations.idiomatic: He moreover deceived the grand masters, saying: 'Gao Zhao Zi is fearful. Strike first before he has not sent.'

sentences.zh: 諸大夫從之。

translations.literal: The grand masters followed him.
translations.idiomatic: All the high officials followed him.

sentences.zh: 田乞、鮑牧與大夫以兵入公室，攻高昭子。

translations.literal: Tian Qi and Bao Mu, with the grand masters, entered the ducal chambers with troops and attacked Gao Zhao Zi.
translations.idiomatic: Tian Qi, Bao Mu, and the high officials entered the ducal palace with troops, attacking Gao Zhao Zi.

sentences.zh: 昭子聞之，與國惠子救公。

translations.literal: Zhao Zi heard this and, with Guo Hui Zi, saved the gong.
translations.idiomatic: Zhao Zi heard of it and together with Guo Hui Zi rescued the duke.

sentences.zh: 公師敗。

translations.literal: The gong's army was defeated.
translations.idiomatic: The duke's army was defeated.

sentences.zh: 田乞之眾追國惠子，惠子奔莒，遂返殺高昭子。

translations.literal: Tian Qi's masses pursued Guo Hui Zi. Hui Zi fled to Ju, and thus they returned and killed Gao Zhao Zi.
translations.idiomatic: Tian Qi's forces pursued Guo Hui Zi. Hui Zi fled to Ju, then they turned back and killed Gao Zhao Zi.

sentences.zh: 晏（孺子）［圉］奔魯。

translations.literal: Yan Yu fled to Lu.
translations.idiomatic: Duke Shao fled to Lu.

translations.literal: Duke Jing's crown prince died, and later he had a favored concubine called Rui Zi who bore a son Tu. Duke Jing fell ill and commanded his chancellor Guo Hui Zi and Gao Zhao Zi to make Zi Tu crown prince. Duke Jing died, and the two chancellors Gao and Guo established Tu, who became Yan Ruzi. But Tian Qi was displeased and desired to establish Duke Jing's other son Yang Sheng. Yang Sheng had long been on good terms with Qi. When Yan Ruzi was established, Yang Sheng fled to Lu. Tian Qi falsely served Gao Zhao Zi and Guo Hui Zi, and at every court session took turns as their chariot companion, saying: 'At first the various grandees did not want to establish Ruzi. Now that Ruzi is established, you two chancellors support him, and all the grandees feel endangered and are plotting rebellion.' He also deceived the grandees: 'Gao Zhao Zi is fearsome; while he has not yet acted, strike first.' The various grandees followed this. Tian Qi and Bao Mu entered the ducal palace with the grandees and troops, attacking Gao Zhao Zi. Zhao Zi heard of it and with Guo Hui Zi went to save the duke. The duke's forces were defeated. Tian Qi's multitude pursued Guo Hui Zi; Hui Zi fled to Ju, then they returned and killed Gao Zhao Zi. Yan Yu fled to Lu.

sentences.zh: 田乞使人之魯，迎陽生。

translations.literal: Tian Qi sent people to Lu to welcome Yang Sheng.
translations.idiomatic: Tian Qi sent people to Lu to welcome Yang Sheng.

sentences.zh: 陽生至齊，匿田乞家。

translations.literal: Yang Sheng arrived in Qi and hid in Tian Qi's home.

sentences.zh: 請諸大夫曰：「常之母有魚菽之祭，幸而來會飲。」

translations.literal: Invited grand masters said: 'Chang mother has fish bean sacrifice, fortunate come gather drink.'
translations.idiomatic: He invited the grand masters, saying: 'Chang's mother has a fish and bean sacrifice. It would be fortunate if you came to gather and drink.'

sentences.zh: 會飲田氏。

translations.literal: They gathered and drank at the Tian clan.

sentences.zh: 田乞盛陽生橐中，置坐中央。

translations.literal: Tian Qi placed Yang Sheng in a bag and put the seat in the center.

sentences.zh: 發橐，出陽生，曰：「此乃齊君矣。」

translations.literal: Opened bag, brought out Yang Sheng, said: 'This is Qi jun.'
translations.idiomatic: He opened the bag and brought out Yang Sheng, saying: 'This is the Qi jun.'

sentences.zh: 大夫皆伏謁。

translations.literal: All the grand masters prostrated and greeted him.

sentences.zh: 將盟立之，田乞誣曰：「吾與鮑牧謀共立陽生也。」

translations.literal: About to ally establish him, Tian Qi falsely said: 'I with Bao Mu planned together establish Yang Sheng.'
translations.idiomatic: They were about to ally and establish him. Tian Qi falsely said: 'Bao Mu and I planned together to establish Yang Sheng.'

sentences.zh: 鮑牧怒曰：「大夫忘景公之命乎？」

translations.literal: Bao Mu angry said: 'Grand masters forget Jing Gong command?'
translations.idiomatic: Bao Mu angrily said: 'Do the grand masters forget Jing Gong's command?'

sentences.zh: 諸大夫欲悔，陽生乃頓首曰：「可則立之，不可則已。」

translations.literal: Grand masters desired regret, Yang Sheng thus kowtowed said: 'Acceptable then establish him, not acceptable then stop.'
translations.idiomatic: The grand masters desired to regret it. Yang Sheng thus kowtowed and said: 'If acceptable, then establish him. If not acceptable, then stop.'

sentences.zh: 鮑牧恐禍及己，乃復曰：「皆景公之子，何為不可！」

translations.literal: Bao Mu feared calamity reach self, thus again said: 'All Jing Gong sons, why not acceptable!'
translations.idiomatic: Bao Mu feared calamity would reach himself, so he again said: 'They are all Jing Gong's sons. Why would it not be acceptable!'

sentences.zh: 遂立陽生於田乞之家，是為悼公。

translations.literal: Thus they established Yang Sheng at Tian Qi's home, called Dao Gong.

sentences.zh: 乃使人遷晏孺子於駘，而殺孺子荼。

translations.literal: Thus they sent people to move Yan Ru Zi to Dai and killed Ru Zi Tu.

sentences.zh: 悼公既立，田乞為相，專齊政。

translations.literal: After Dao Gong was established, Tian Qi became chancellor and monopolized Qi's governance.

Tian Qi sent people to Lu to welcome Yang Sheng. Yang Sheng arrived in Qi and hid in Tian Qi's home. He invited the various grandees: 'My mother's regular fish and bean sacrifice is happening; do me the honor of coming to drink together.' They gathered to drink at the Tian clan. Tian Qi hid Yang Sheng in a bag and placed it in the center of the seats. He opened the bag and brought out Yang Sheng, saying: 'This is the lord of Qi.' All the grandees prostrated themselves in audience. When they were about to covenant and establish him, Tian Qi falsely said: 'Bao Mu and I plotted together to establish Yang Sheng.' Bao Mu angrily said: 'Have the grandees forgotten Duke Jing's command?' The various grandees wanted to back out, but Yang Sheng kowtowed and said: 'If possible, establish me; if not, let it be.' Bao Mu feared calamity would reach him, so he replied: 'All are sons of Duke Jing, why should it not be possible!' Thus Yang Sheng was established in Tian Qi's home, becoming Duke Dao. Then people were sent to move Yan Ruzi to Tai, and Ruzi Tu was killed. Once Duke Dao was established, Tian Qi became chancellor and monopolized Qi's governance.

sentences.zh: 四年，田乞卒，子常代立，是為田成子。

translations.literal: In the fourth year, Tian Qi died. His son Chang succeeded and was established, called Tian Cheng Zi.
After four years, Tian Qi died, and his son Chang took his place, becoming Tian Cheng Zi.

sentences.zh: 鮑牧與齊悼公有郄，弒悼公。

translations.literal: Bao Mu had a grudge with Qi Dao Gong and assassinated Dao Gong.

sentences.zh: 齊人共立其子壬，是為簡公。

translations.literal: The Qi people together established his son Ren, called Jian Gong.

sentences.zh: 田常成子與監止俱為左右相，相簡公。

translations.literal: Tian Chang Cheng Zi and Jian Zhi together became the left and right chancellors and assisted Jian Gong.

sentences.zh: 田常心害監止，監止幸於簡公，權弗能去。

translations.literal: Tian Chang's heart harmed Jian Zhi. Jian Zhi was favored by Jian Gong, so his power could not be removed.

sentences.zh: 於是田常復修釐子之政，以大斗出貸，以小斗收。

translations.literal: Thus Tian Chang again practiced Xi Zi's policy: gave loans with large measures but collected with small measures.

sentences.zh: 齊人歌之曰：「嫗乎采芑，歸乎田成子！」

translations.literal: Qi people sang said: 'Old woman harvest vegetables, return to Tian Cheng Zi!'
translations.idiomatic: The Qi people sang: 'Old woman harvesting vegetables, return to Tian Cheng Zi!'

sentences.zh: 齊大夫朝，御鞅諫簡公曰：「田、監不可并也，君其擇焉。」

translations.literal: Qi grand masters court, Yu Yang advised Jian Gong said: 'Tian, Jian cannot together, jun choose one.'
translations.idiomatic: The Qi grand masters at court - Yu Yang advised Jian Gong: 'Tian and Jian cannot be together. Your Majesty should choose one.'

sentences.zh: 君弗聽。

translations.literal: The jun did not listen.

Bao Mu had a grudge against Duke Dao of Qi and assassinated Duke Dao. The Qi people together established his son Ren, who became Duke Jian. Tian Chang Cheng Zi and Jian Zhi both became left and right chancellors, assisting Duke Jian. Tian Chang harbored hatred for Jian Zhi in his heart, but Jian Zhi was favored by Duke Jian, so Tian Chang could not remove his power. Then Tian Chang revived Xi Zi's policies, lending with large measures and collecting with small measures. The Qi people sang of it: 'Old woman, gathering qi, return to Tian Cheng Zi!' When the Qi grandees attended court, Yu Yang admonished Duke Jian: 'Tian and Jian cannot coexist; Your Lordship should choose between them.' The lord would not listen.

sentences.zh: 子我者，監止之宗人也，常與田氏有卻。

translations.literal: Zi Wo was a clan member of Jian Zhi and often had enmity with the Tian clan.

sentences.zh: 田氏疏族田豹事子我有寵。

translations.literal: Tian Bao, a distant relative of the Tian clan, served Zi Wo and had favor.

sentences.zh: 子我曰：「吾欲盡滅田氏適，以豹代田氏宗。」

translations.literal: Zi Wo said: 'I desire completely extinguish Tian clan direct descendants, use Bao replace Tian clan ancestor.'
translations.idiomatic: Zi Wo said: 'I desire to completely extinguish the Tian clan's direct descendants and use Bao to replace the Tian clan ancestor.'

sentences.zh: 豹曰：「臣於田氏疏矣。」

translations.literal: Bao said: 'Minister to Tian clan distant.'
translations.idiomatic: Bao said: 'This minister is distant from the Tian clan.'

sentences.zh: 不聽。

translations.literal: He did not listen.

sentences.zh: 已而豹謂田氏曰：「子我將誅田氏，田氏弗先，禍及矣。」

translations.literal: Then Bao told Tian clan said: 'Zi Wo will execute Tian clan, Tian clan not strike first, calamity reach.'
translations.idiomatic: Then Bao told the Tian clan: 'Zi Wo will execute the Tian clan. If the Tian clan does not strike first, calamity will reach them.'

sentences.zh: 子我舍公宮，田常兄弟四人乘如公宮，欲殺子我。
子我閉門。
簡公與婦人飲檀臺，將欲擊田常。
太史子餘曰：「田常非敢為亂，將除害。」
簡公乃止。
田常出，聞簡公怒，恐誅，將出亡。
田子行曰：「需，事之賊也。」
田常於是擊子我。
子我率其徒攻田氏，不勝，出亡。
田氏之徒追殺子我及監止。

translations.literal: Zi Wo was a clansman of Jian Zhi and constantly had grievances with the Tian clan. Tian Bao, a distant clansman of the Tian clan, served Zi Wo and was favored. Zi Wo said: 'I want to exterminate all the Tian clan's legitimate heirs and replace the Tian clan leadership with Bao.' Bao said: 'I am distant from the Tian clan.' He would not listen. Later Bao told the Tian clan: 'Zi Wo is about to execute the Tian clan; if the Tian clan does not strike first, calamity will reach you.' Zi Wo lodged in the ducal palace, and Tian Chang's four brothers rode to the ducal palace, desiring to kill Zi Wo. Zi Wo closed the gates. Duke Jian was drinking with women on Tan Terrace and was about to attack Tian Chang. Grand Historian Zi Yu said: 'Tian Chang does not dare rebel; he is about to remove harm.' Duke Jian then stopped. Tian Chang went out, heard that Duke Jian was angry, feared execution, and was about to flee. Tian Zi Xing said: 'Delay is the thief of affairs.' Tian Chang then attacked Zi Wo. Zi Wo led his followers to attack the Tian clan but did not prevail, so fled. The Tian clan's followers pursued and killed Zi Wo and Jian Zhi.

sentences.zh: 簡公出奔，田氏之徒追執簡公于徐州。
簡公曰：「蚤從御鞅之言，不及此難。」
田氏之徒恐簡公復立而誅己，遂殺簡公。
簡公立四年而殺。
於是田常立簡公弟驁，是為平公。
平公即位，田常為相。

translations.literal: Duke Jian fled, and the Tian clan's followers pursued and captured Duke Jian at Xuzhou. Duke Jian said: 'If only I had followed Yu Yang's words earlier, I would not have reached this difficulty.' The Tian clan's followers feared Duke Jian would be reestablished and execute them, so they killed Duke Jian. Duke Jian had been established four years when he was killed. Then Tian Chang established Duke Jian's younger brother Ao, who became Duke Ping. Once Duke Ping ascended, Tian Chang became chancellor.

sentences.zh: 田常既殺簡公，懼諸侯共誅己，乃盡歸魯、衛侵地，西約晉、韓、魏、趙氏，南通吳、越之使，修功行賞，親於百姓，以故齊復定。

translations.literal: Tian Chang, having killed Duke Jian, feared the feudal lords would together execute him, so he returned all the invaded lands to Lu and Wei, made covenants to the west with the Jin, Han, Wei, and Zhao clans, opened communications to the south with Wu and Yue envoys, rewarded merit and performed favors, and was close to the common people, which is why Qi was again pacified.

sentences.zh: 田常言於齊平公曰：「德施人之所欲，君其行之；
刑罰人之所惡，臣請行之。」
行之五年，齊國之政皆歸田常。
田常於是盡誅鮑、晏、監止及公族之彊者，而割齊自安平以東至瑯邪，自為封邑。
封邑大於平公之所食。

translations.literal: Tian Chang spoke to Duke Ping of Qi: 'Bestow virtue on what people desire; Your Lordship should perform it; Administer punishments on what people hate; I request to perform it.' After five years of this, all Qi's governance returned to Tian Chang. Tian Chang then executed all the Bao, Yan, Jian Zhi clans and the strong ones of the ducal clan, and carved out Qi territory from Anping eastward to Langya as his own fief. His fief was larger than what Duke Ping ate from.

sentences.zh: 田常乃選齊國中女子長七尺以上為後宮，後宮以百數，而使賓客舍人出入後宮者不禁。
及田常卒，有七十餘男。

translations.literal: Tian Chang then selected women from Qi who were seven chi tall or more for his harem, his harem numbering in the hundreds, and allowed guests and retainers to enter and leave the harem without restriction. When Tian Chang died, he had over seventy sons.

sentences.zh: 田常卒，子襄子盤代立，相齊。
常謚為成子。

translations.literal: Tian Chang died, and his son Xiang Zi Pan took his place, assisting Qi. Chang was posthumously titled Cheng Zi.

sentences.zh: 田襄子既相齊宣公，三晉殺知伯，分其地。
襄子使其兄弟宗人盡為齊都邑大夫，與三晉通使，且以有齊國。

translations.literal: Tian Xiang Zi, having assisted Duke Xuan of Qi, saw the three Jin kill Zhi Bo and divide his lands. Xiang Zi had all his brothers and clansmen become grandees of Qi's cities and towns, opened communications with the three Jin, and thereby possessed Qi.

sentences.zh: 襄子卒，子莊子白立。
田莊子相齊宣公。
宣公四十三年，伐晉，毀黃城，圍陽狐。
明年，伐魯、葛及安陵。
明年，取魯之一城。

translations.literal: Xiang Zi died, and his son Zhuang Zi Bai established himself. Tian Zhuang Zi assisted Duke Xuan of Qi. In Duke Xuan's forty-third year, he attacked Jin, destroyed Huang Castle, and besieged Yanghu. The next year, he attacked Lu, Ge, and Anling. The next year, he took one city from Lu.

sentences.zh: 莊子卒，子太公和立。
田太公相齊宣公。
宣公四十八年，取魯之城。
明年，宣公與鄭人會西城。
伐衛，取毋丘。
宣公五十一年卒，田會自廩丘反。

translations.literal: Zhuang Zi died, and his son Tai Gong He established himself. Tian Tai Gong assisted Duke Xuan of Qi. In Duke Xuan's forty-eighth year, he took cities from Lu. The next year, Duke Xuan met with Zheng people at Xicheng. He attacked Wei and took Wuqiu. Duke Xuan died in his fifty-first year, and Tian Hui rebelled from Linqiu.

sentences.zh: 宣公卒，子康公貸立。
貸立十四年，淫於酒婦人，不聽政。
太公乃遷康公於海上，食一城，以奉其先祀。
明年，魯敗齊平陸。

translations.literal: Duke Xuan died, and his son Duke Kang Dai ascended. Dai had been established fourteen years, debauched with wine and women, not attending to governance. Tai Gong then moved Duke Kang to the seacoast, giving him one city to eat from, to maintain the ancestral sacrifices. The next year, Lu defeated Qi at Pinglu.

sentences.zh: 齊侯太公和立二年，和卒，子桓公午立。
桓公午五年，秦、魏攻韓，韓求救於齊。
齊桓公召大臣而謀曰：「蚤救之孰與晚救之？」
騶忌曰：「不若勿救。」
段干朋曰：「不救，則韓且折而入於魏，不若救之。」
田臣思曰：「過矣君之謀也！
秦、魏攻韓、楚，趙必救之，是天以燕予齊也。」
桓公曰：「善」。
乃陰告韓使者而遣之。
韓自以為得齊之救，因與秦、魏戰。
楚、趙聞之，果起兵而救之。
齊因起兵襲燕國，取桑丘。

translations.literal: Qi marquis Tai Gong He had been established two years when He died, and his son Duke Huan Wu ascended. In Duke Huan Wu's fifth year, Qin and Wei attacked Han, and Han sought aid from Qi. Duke Huan of Qi summoned his ministers and plotted: 'Which is better—to save them early or late?' Zou Ji said: 'It would be better not to save them.' Duan Gan Peng said: 'If we do not save them, Han will break and enter Wei; it would be better to save them.' Tian Chen Si said: 'Your Lordship's plan is wrong! Qin and Wei attack Han and Chu; Zhao will certainly save them. This is Heaven giving Yan to Qi.' Duke Huan said: 'Good.' Then secretly informed the Han envoy and sent him away. Han, thinking they had obtained Qi's aid, therefore fought with Qin and Wei. Chu and Zhao heard of it and indeed raised troops to save them. Qi therefore raised troops to attack Yan and took Sangqiu.

sentences.zh: 六年，救衛。
桓公卒，子威王因齊立。
是歲，故齊康公卒，絕無後，奉邑皆入田氏。

translations.literal: In the sixth year, they saved Wei. Duke Huan died, and his son King Wei Yin Qi ascended. In this year, the former Duke Kang of Qi died without heirs, and all his fief territories entered the Tian clan.

sentences.zh: 騶忌子以鼓琴見威王，威王說而捨之右室。
須臾，王鼓琴，騶忌子推戶入曰：「善哉鼓琴！」
王勃然不說，去琴按劍曰：「夫子見容未察，何以知其善也？」
騶忌子曰：「夫大弦濁以春溫者，君也；
小弦廉折以清者，相也；
攫之深，醳之愉者，政令也；
鈞諧以鳴，大小相益，回邪而不相害者，四時也：吾是以知其善也。」
王曰：「善語音。」
騶忌子曰：「何獨語音，夫治國家而弭人民皆在其中。」
王又勃然不說曰：「若夫語五音之紀，信未有如夫子者也。
若夫治國家而弭人民，又何為乎絲桐之閒？」
騶忌子曰：「夫大弦濁以春溫者，君也；
小弦廉折以清者，相也；
攫之深而捨之愉者，政令也；
鈞諧以鳴，大小相益，回邪而不相害者，四時也。
夫復而不亂者，所以治昌也；
連而徑者，所以存亡也：故曰琴音調而天下治。
夫治國家而弭人民者，無若乎五音者。」
王曰：「善。」

translations.literal: Zou Ji Zi presented himself to King Wei by playing the qin, and King Wei was pleased and housed him in the right chamber. After a moment, the king played the qin, and Zou Ji Zi pushed open the door and entered, saying: 'Excellent qin playing!' The king suddenly displeased, set aside the qin and pressed his sword, saying: 'Sir, you have seen the appearance but not examined closely; how do you know it is good?' Zou Ji Zi said: 'The deep booming of the thick strings like spring warmth is the ruler; The sharp clarity of the thin strings is the chancellor; The deep plucking and smooth release is governance and commands; The balanced harmony in sound, large and small mutually benefiting, winding and turning without harming each other is the four seasons. This is why I know it is good.' The king said: 'Excellent discourse on music.' Zou Ji Zi said: 'Why speak only of music? Governing the state and pacifying the people are all contained within it.' The king again suddenly displeased, said: 'As for discourse on the principles of the five tones, truly there is none like you. As for governing the state and pacifying the people, what has it to do with the space between silk and paulownia?' Zou Ji Zi said: 'The deep booming of the thick strings like spring warmth is the ruler; The sharp clarity of the thin strings is the chancellor; The deep plucking and smooth release is governance and commands; The balanced harmony in sound, large and small mutually benefiting, winding and turning without harming each other is the four seasons. The repeated yet not disordered is what governs flourishing; The connected yet direct is what preserves existence: therefore it is said that when the qin's sound is harmonious, the empire is governed. For governing the state and pacifying the people, nothing compares to the five tones.' The king said: 'Good.'

sentences.zh: 騶忌子見三月而受相印。
淳于髡見之曰：「善說哉！
髡有愚志，願陳諸前。」
騶忌子曰：「謹受教。」
淳于髡曰：「得全全昌，失全全亡。」
騶忌子曰：「謹受令，請謹毋離前。」
淳于髡曰：「狶膏棘軸，所以為滑也，然而不能運方穿。」
騶忌子曰：「謹受令，請謹事左右。」
淳于髡曰：「弓膠昔干，所以為合也，然而不能傅合疏罅。」
騶忌子曰：「謹受令，請謹自附於萬民。」
淳于髡曰：「狐裘雖敝，不可補以黃狗之皮。」
騶忌子曰：「謹受令，請謹擇君子，毋雜小人其閒。」
淳于髡曰：「大車不較，不能載其常任；
琴瑟不較，不能成其五音。」
騶忌子曰：「謹受令，請謹修法律而督姦吏。」
淳于髡說畢，趨出，至門，而面其仆曰：「是人者，吾語之微言五，其應我若響之應聲，是人必封不久矣。」
居朞，封以下邳，號曰成侯。

translations.literal: Zou Ji Zi had been seen for three months when he received the chancellor's seal. Chunyu Kun saw him and said: 'Excellent persuasion! Kun has a foolish plan that I wish to lay before you.' Zou Ji Zi said: 'I respectfully receive instruction.' Chunyu Kun said: 'If you gain all, all flourishes; if you lose all, all perishes.' Zou Ji Zi said: 'I respectfully receive the command; I request to carefully not depart from what is before.' Chunyu Kun said: 'Xi grease and thorn axles make for smoothness, yet cannot move square holes.' Zou Ji Zi said: 'I respectfully receive the command; I request to carefully serve the attendants.' Chunyu Kun said: 'Bow glue and Xi wood make for joining, yet cannot fill wide cracks.' Zou Ji Zi said: 'I respectfully receive the command; I request to carefully attach myself to the ten thousand people.' Chunyu Kun said: 'Though a fox fur robe is worn, it cannot be patched with yellow dog skin.' Zou Ji Zi said: 'I respectfully receive the command; I request to carefully choose worthy men and not mix petty men among them.' Chunyu Kun said: 'A large cart without linchpins cannot carry its regular load; Qin and se without linchpins cannot complete their five tones.' Zou Ji Zi said: 'I respectfully receive the command; I request to carefully repair the laws and oversee corrupt officials.' Chunyu Kun finished speaking, hurried out, reached the gate, and turned to face his charioteer: 'This man—I spoke five subtle words to him, and he responded to me like an echo responds to sound. This man will certainly be enfeoffed before long.' After a season, he was enfeoffed with Xiapi, titled Cheng Hou.

sentences.zh: 威王二十三年，與趙王會平陸。
二十四年，與魏王會田於郊。
魏王問曰：「王亦有寶乎？」
威王曰：「無有。」
梁王曰：「若寡人國小也，尚有徑寸之珠照車前後各十二乘者十枚，奈何以萬乘之國而無寶乎？」
威王曰：「寡人之所以為寶與王異。
吾臣有檀子者，使守南城，則楚人不敢為寇東取，泗上十二諸侯皆來朝。
吾臣有子者，使守高唐，則趙人不敢東漁於河。
吾吏有黔夫者，使守徐州，則燕人祭北門，趙人祭西門，徙而從者七千餘家。
吾臣有種首者，使備盜賊，則道不拾遺。
將以照千里，豈特十二乘哉！」
梁惠王慚，不懌而去。

translations.literal: In King Wei's twenty-third year, he met with the King of Zhao at Pinglu. In the twenty-fourth year, he met with the King of Wei for a hunt in the suburbs. The King of Wei asked: 'Does Your Majesty also have treasures?' King Wei said: 'None.' The King of Liang said: 'Though my kingdom is small, I still have pearls one inch in diameter that illuminate twelve chariots before and behind, ten pairs of them. How can a kingdom of ten thousand chariots have no treasures?' King Wei said: 'What I consider treasures differs from Your Majesty's. I have a minister named Tan Zi; when I had him defend Nancheng, the Chu people dared not raid eastward, and the twelve feudal lords above the Si all came to court. I have a minister named Zi; when I had him defend Gaotang, the Zhao people dared not fish eastward on the river. I have an official named Qian Fu; when I had him defend Xuzhou, the Yan people sacrificed at the north gate, the Zhao people at the west gate, and those who moved to follow him numbered over seven thousand households. I have a minister named Zhong Shou; when I had him prepare against bandits, the roads were free of lost items. These illuminate a thousand li—how merely twelve chariots!' King Hui of Liang was ashamed and displeased as he departed.

sentences.zh: 二十六年，魏惠王圍邯鄲，趙求救於齊。
齊威王召大臣而謀曰：「救趙孰與勿救？」
騶忌子曰：「不如勿救。」
段干朋曰：「不救則不義，且不利。」
威王曰：「何也？」
對曰：「夫魏氏并邯鄲，其於齊何利哉？
且夫救趙而軍其郊，是趙不伐而魏全也。
故不如南攻襄陵以獘魏，邯鄲拔而乘魏之獘。」
威王從其計。

translations.literal: In the twenty-sixth year, King Hui of Wei besieged Handan, and Zhao sought aid from Qi. King Wei of Qi summoned his ministers and plotted: 'To save Zhao or not to save?' Zou Ji Zi said: 'It would be better not to save them.' Duan Gan Peng said: 'Not saving would be unrighteous, and moreover disadvantageous.' King Wei said: 'Why?' He replied: 'If Wei swallows Handan, what benefit to Qi? Moreover, to save Zhao by stationing troops in its suburbs means Zhao is not attacked while Wei is preserved intact. Therefore it would be better to attack Xiangling in the south to weaken Wei, then when Handan falls, take advantage of Wei's weakness.' King Wei followed this plan.

sentences.zh: 其後成侯騶忌與田忌不善，公孫閱謂成侯忌曰：「公何不謀伐魏，田忌必將。
戰勝有功，則公之謀中也；
戰不勝，非前死則後北，而命在公矣。」
於是成侯言威王，使田忌南攻襄陵。
十月，邯鄲拔，齊因起兵擊魏，大敗之桂陵。
于是齊最彊于諸侯，自稱為王，以令天下。

translations.literal: Later, Cheng Hou Zou Ji and Tian Ji were on bad terms, and Gongsun Yue spoke to Cheng Hou Ji: 'Why not plot to attack Wei? Tian Ji will certainly command. If victorious with merit, then Your Lordship's plot succeeds; If not victorious, he will either die in front or flee behind, and his fate will be in Your Lordship's hands.' Then Cheng Hou spoke to King Wei, sending Tian Ji to attack Xiangling in the south. In the tenth month, Handan fell, and Qi therefore raised troops to attack Wei, greatly defeating them at Guiling. Then Qi was strongest among the feudal lords, self-styled as king, to command the empire.

sentences.zh: 三十三年，殺其大夫牟辛。

translations.literal: In the thirty-third year, he killed his grandee Mou Xin.

sentences.zh: 三十五年，公孫閱又謂成侯忌曰：「公何不令人操十金卜於市，曰『我田忌之人也。
吾三戰而三勝，聲威天下。
欲為大事，亦吉乎不吉乎』？」
卜者出，因令人捕為之卜者，驗其辭於王之所。
田忌聞之，因率其徒襲攻臨淄，求成侯，不勝而奔。

translations.literal: In the thirty-fifth year, Gongsun Yue again spoke to Cheng Hou Ji: 'Why not have someone take ten jin to divine in the market, saying 'I am Tian Ji's man. I have fought three battles and won three times, my fame and might shaking the empire.' If I desire to do great things, will it be auspicious or inauspicious?' The diviner went out, and they had someone arrest the diviner, verifying the words in the king's presence. Tian Ji heard of it and therefore led his followers to attack Linzi by surprise, seeking Cheng Hou, but did not prevail and fled.

sentences.zh: 三十六年，威王卒，子宣王辟彊立。

translations.literal: In the thirty-sixth year, King Wei died, and his son King Xuan Pi Qiang ascended.

sentences.zh: 二年，魏伐趙。
趙與韓親，共擊魏。
趙不利，戰於南梁。
宣王召田忌復故位。
韓氏請救於齊。
宣王召大臣而謀曰：「蚤救孰與晚救？」
騶忌子曰：「不如勿救。」
田忌曰：「弗救，則韓且折而入於魏，不如蚤救之。」
孫子曰：「夫韓、魏之兵未獘而救之，是吾代韓受魏之兵，顧反聽命於韓也。
且魏有破國之志，韓見亡，必東面而愬於齊矣。
吾因深結韓之親而晚承魏之獘，則可重利而得尊名也。」
宣王曰：「善。」
乃陰告韓之使者而遣之。
韓因恃齊，五戰不勝，而東委國於齊。
齊因起兵，使田忌、田嬰將，孫子為（帥）［師］，救韓、趙以擊魏，大敗之馬陵，殺其將龐涓，虜魏太子申。
其後三晉之王皆因田嬰朝齊王於博望，盟而去。

translations.literal: In the second year, Wei attacked Zhao. Zhao and Han were close and together attacked Wei. Zhao was disadvantaged and fought at Nanliang. King Xuan summoned Tian Ji to restore his former position. The Han clan requested aid from Qi. King Xuan summoned his ministers and plotted: 'To save early or late?' Zou Ji Zi said: 'It would be better not to save.' Tian Ji said: 'If we do not save them, Han will break and enter Wei; it would be better to save them early.' Sun Zi said: 'If we save them when Han and Wei's troops are not yet weakened, we will take Han's place receiving Wei's troops, and moreover take orders from Han instead. Moreover, Wei has the intention to destroy states; when Han sees destruction, they will certainly face east and appeal to Qi. We can deeply bind with Han's friendship and late receive Wei's weakness, then obtain great benefit and honorable name.' King Xuan said: 'Good.' Then secretly informed Han's envoy and sent him away. Han therefore relied on Qi, fought five battles without victory, and entrusted their kingdom to Qi in the east. Qi therefore raised troops, with Tian Ji and Tian Ying as generals and Sun Zi as strategist, saving Han and Zhao to attack Wei, greatly defeating them at Maling, killing their general Pang Juan and capturing Wei's crown prince Shen. Afterward, the kings of the three Jin all came through Tian Ying to court the Qi king at Bowang, made covenant, and departed.

sentences.zh: 七年，與魏王會平阿南。
明年，復會甄。
魏惠王卒。
明年，與魏襄王會徐州，諸侯相王也。
十年，楚圍我徐州。
十一年，與魏伐趙，趙決河水灌齊、魏，兵罷。

translations.literal: In the seventh year, he met with the Wei king south of Ping'a. The next year, he met again at Zhen. King Hui of Wei died. The next year, he met with King Xiang of Wei at Xuzhou, where the feudal lords styled each other as kings. In the tenth year, Chu besieged our Xuzhou. In the eleventh year, together with Wei they attacked Zhao, but Zhao breached the river waters to flood Qi and Wei, and the troops withdrew.

sentences.zh: 十八年，宣王喜文學游說之士，自如騶衍、淳于髡、田駢、接子、慎到、環淵之徒七十六人，皆賜列第，為上大夫，不治而議論。
是以齊稷下學士復盛，且數百千人。

translations.literal: In the eighteenth year, King Xuan delighted in literary scholars and persuaders, such as Zou Yan, Chunyu Kun, Tian Pian, Jie Zi, Shen Dao, Huan Yuan and their followers, seventy-six men, all granted mansions in rows, made upper grandees, exempt from administration to engage in discussion. Therefore the scholars at Jixia flourished again, numbering several hundred to a thousand.

sentences.zh: 十九年，宣王卒，子湣王地立。

translations.literal: In the nineteenth year, King Xuan died, and his son King Min Di ascended.

sentences.zh: 十二年，攻魏。
楚圍雍氏，秦敗屈丐。
蘇代謂田軫曰：「臣願有謁於公，其為事甚完，使楚利公，成為福，不成亦為福。
今者臣立於門，客有言曰魏王謂韓馮、張儀曰：『煮棗將拔，齊兵又進，子來救寡人則可矣；
不救寡人，寡人弗能拔。』
此特轉辭也。
秦、韓之兵毋東，旬餘，則魏氏轉韓從秦，秦逐張儀，交臂而事齊楚，此公之事成也。」
田軫曰：「柰何使無東？」
對曰：「韓馮之救魏之辭，必不謂韓王曰『馮以為魏』，必曰『馮將以秦韓之兵東卻齊宋，馮因摶三國之兵，乘屈丐之獘，南割於楚，故地必盡得之矣』。
張儀救魏之辭，必不謂秦王曰『儀以為魏』，必曰『儀且以秦韓之兵東距齊宋，儀將摶三國之兵，乘屈丐之獘，南割於楚，名存亡國，實伐三川而歸，此王業也』。
公令楚王與韓氏地，使秦制和，謂秦王曰『請與韓地，而王以施三川，韓氏之兵不用而得地於楚』。
韓馮之東兵之辭且謂秦何？
曰『秦兵不用而得三川，伐楚韓以窘魏，魏氏不敢東，是孤齊也』。
張儀之東兵之辭且謂何？
曰『秦韓欲地而兵有案，聲威發於魏，魏氏之欲不失齊楚者有資矣』。
魏氏轉秦韓爭事齊楚，楚王欲而無與地，公令秦韓之兵不用而得地，有一大德也。
秦韓之王劫於韓馮、張儀而東兵以徇服魏，公常執左券以責於秦韓，此其善於公而惡張子多資矣。」

translations.literal: In the twelfth year, he attacked Wei. Chu besieged Yongshi, and Qin defeated Qu Gai. Su Dai spoke to Tian Zhen: 'I wish to have an audience with you; this matter is very complete, making Chu benefit you—if successful it becomes fortune, if not it also becomes fortune. Just now as I stood at the gate, a guest said the Wei king told Han Feng and Zhang Yi: 'The cooked jujube is about to be plucked, Qi troops advance again; if you come save me it will be fine; If you do not save me, I cannot pluck it.' This is merely persuasive words. If Qin and Han's troops do not go east, in ten days more, then Wei will turn Han to follow Qin, Qin will drive out Zhang Yi, and join arms to serve Qi and Chu—this will complete your lordship's affair.' Tian Zhen said: 'How to make them not go east?' He replied: 'Han Feng's words about saving Wei will certainly not say to the Han king 'Feng thinks of Wei', but will say 'Feng will use Qin and Han's troops to push back Qi and Song to the east, Feng will gather the three kingdoms' troops, take advantage of Qu Gai's weakness, carve territory from Chu to the south, and certainly regain all the old lands.' Zhang Yi's words about saving Wei will certainly not say to the Qin king 'Yi thinks of Wei', but will say 'Yi will use Qin and Han's troops to resist Qi and Song to the east, Yi will gather the three kingdoms' troops, take advantage of Qu Gai's weakness, carve territory from Chu to the south, nominally to save a perishing kingdom but actually to attack Sanchuan and return—this is kingly enterprise.' Have the Chu king give land to Han, have Qin arrange peace, and tell the Qin king 'Please give land to Han, and Your Majesty bestow it on Sanchuan; Han's troops will not be used but you will gain land from Chu.' What will Han Feng's words about sending troops east say to Qin? He will say 'Qin troops not used but gain Sanchuan, attack Chu and Han to distress Wei, Wei will not dare go east, thus isolating Qi.' What will Zhang Yi's words about sending troops east say? He will say 'Qin and Han desire land but troops are stationed, fame and might issue from Wei, Wei's desire not to lose Qi and Chu will be supported.' Wei will turn Qin and Han to vie in serving Qi and Chu; the Chu king desires this but has no land to give, you make Qin and Han's troops unused yet gain land—there is great virtue in this. The kings of Qin and Han will be coerced by Han Feng and Zhang Yi to send troops east to submit to Wei, you will constantly hold the left tally to demand from Qin and Han—this will be good for you but bad for Zhang Zi, providing much support.'

sentences.zh: 十三年，秦惠王卒。
二十三年，與秦擊敗楚於重丘。
二十四年，秦使涇陽君質於齊。
二十五年，歸涇陽君于秦。
孟嘗君薛文入秦，即相秦。
文亡去。
二十六年，齊與韓魏共攻秦，至函谷軍焉。
二十八年，秦與韓河外以和，兵罷。
二十九年，趙殺其主父。
齊佐趙滅中山。

translations.literal: In the thirteenth year, King Hui of Qin died. In the twenty-third year, together with Qin they defeated Chu at Chongqiu. In the twenty-fourth year, Qin sent Lord Jingyang as hostage to Qi. In the twenty-fifth year, they returned Lord Jingyang to Qin. Lord Mengchang Xue Wen entered Qin and immediately became chancellor of Qin. Wen fled. In the twenty-sixth year, Qi together with Han and Wei attacked Qin, reaching Hangu Pass where they encamped. In the twenty-eighth year, Qin and Han made peace regarding the lands outside the river, and troops withdrew. In the twenty-ninth year, Zhao killed its Lord Father. Qi aided Zhao in destroying Zhongshan.

sentences.zh: 三十六年，王為東帝，秦昭王為西帝。
蘇代自燕來，入齊，見於章華東門。
齊王曰：「嘻，善，子來！
秦使魏冉致帝，子以為何如？」
對曰：「王之問臣也卒，而患之所從來微，願王受之而勿備稱也。
秦稱之，天下安之，王乃稱之，無後也。
且讓爭帝名，無傷也。
秦稱之，天下惡之，王因勿稱，以收天下，此大資也。
且天下立兩帝，王以天下為尊齊乎？
尊秦乎？」
王曰：「尊秦。」
曰：「釋帝，天下愛齊乎？
愛秦乎？」
王曰：「愛齊而憎秦。」
曰：「兩帝立約伐趙，孰與伐桀宋之利？」
王曰：「伐桀宋利。」
對曰：「夫約鈞，然與秦為帝而天下獨尊秦而輕齊，釋帝則天下愛齊而憎秦，伐趙不如伐桀宋之利，故願王明釋帝以收天下，倍約賓秦，無爭重，而王以其閒舉宋。
夫有宋，衛之陽地危；
有濟西，趙之阿東國危；
有淮北，楚之東國危；
有陶、平陸，梁門不開。
釋帝而貸之以伐桀宋之事，國重而名尊，燕楚所以形服，天下莫敢不聽，此湯武之舉也。
敬秦以為名，而後使天下憎之，此所謂以卑為尊者也。
願王孰慮之。」
於是齊去帝復為王，秦亦去帝位。

translations.literal: In the thirty-sixth year, the king became Eastern Emperor, and King Zhao of Qin became Western Emperor. Su Dai came from Yan, entered Qi, and was seen at the east gate of Zhanghua Palace. The Qi king said: 'Ah, good, you have come! Qin has sent Wei Ran to confer the title of emperor; what do you think?' He replied: 'Your Majesty's question to me is abrupt, and the source of the trouble is subtle; I wish Your Majesty to accept it but not fully style yourself as such. If Qin styles itself as such and the empire accepts it, then Your Majesty may style yourself as such, with no harm. Moreover, yielding or contending for the emperor title does no harm. If Qin styles itself as such and the empire hates it, Your Majesty should therefore not style yourself as such, to gather the empire—this is great support. Moreover, if the empire establishes two emperors, does Your Majesty think the empire will honor Qi? Or honor Qin?' The king said: 'Honor Qin.' He said: 'If we relinquish the emperor title, will the empire love Qi? Or love Qin?' The king said: 'Love Qi and hate Qin.' He said: 'If the two emperors covenant to attack Zhao, which is more advantageous than attacking the wicked Song?' The king said: 'Attacking the wicked Song is advantageous.' He replied: 'The covenants are equal, yet partnering with Qin as emperor means the empire alone honors Qin and slight Qi; relinquishing the emperor title means the empire loves Qi and hates Qin. Attacking Zhao is not as advantageous as attacking the wicked Song. Therefore I wish Your Majesty to clearly relinquish the emperor title to gather the empire, double-cross the covenant to make Qin our guest, avoid contending for supremacy, and in the interval Your Majesty may take Song. For if we have Song, Wei's southern lands are endangered; If we have the west of Ji, Zhao's eastern dependencies are endangered; If we have the north of Huai, Chu's eastern territories are endangered; If we have Tao and Pinglu, Liang's gates will not open. Relinquish the emperor title and lend this pretext of attacking the wicked Song, the kingdom will be weighty and the name honored, Yan and Chu will submit in form, the empire will dare not disobey—this is the action of Tang and Wu. Respect Qin nominally, then afterward make the empire hate them—this is called using humility to achieve honor. I wish Your Majesty to carefully consider this.' Then Qi relinquished the emperor title and became king again, Qin also relinquished the emperor position.

sentences.zh: 三十八年，伐宋。
秦昭王怒曰：「吾愛宋與愛新城、陽晉同。
韓聶與吾友也，而攻吾所愛，何也？」
蘇代為齊謂秦王曰：「韓聶之攻宋，所以為王也。
齊彊，輔之以宋，楚魏必恐，恐必西事秦，是王不煩一兵，不傷一士，無事而割安邑也，此韓聶之所禱於王也。」
秦王曰：「吾患齊之難知。
一從一衡，其說何也？」
對曰：「天下國令齊可知乎？
齊以攻宋，其知事秦以萬乘之國自輔，不西事秦則宋治不安。
中國白頭游敖之士皆積智欲離齊秦之交，伏式結軼西馳者，未有一人言善齊者也，伏式結軼東馳者，未有一人言善秦者也。
何則？
皆不欲齊秦之合也。
何晉楚之智而齊秦之愚也！
晉楚合必議齊秦，齊秦合必圖晉楚，請以此決事。」
秦王曰：「諾。」
於是齊遂伐宋，宋王出亡，死於溫。
齊南割楚之淮北，西侵三晉，欲以并周室，為天子。
泗上諸侯鄒魯之君皆稱臣，諸侯恐懼。

translations.literal: In the thirty-eighth year, they attacked Song. King Zhao of Qin angrily said: 'I love Song the same as I love Xincheng and Yangjin. Han Nie is my friend, yet you attack what I love—why?' Su Dai, on behalf of Qi, spoke to the Qin king: 'Han Nie's attack on Song is actually for Your Majesty's benefit. If Qi grows strong and is aided by Song, Chu and Wei will certainly fear, and in fear they will certainly serve Qin to the west. This means Your Majesty troubles not one soldier, harms not one warrior, and without effort carves out Anyi—this is what Han Nie prays for from Your Majesty.' The Qin king said: 'I am troubled by Qi's unpredictability. Sometimes allied, sometimes opposed—what explanation is there?' He replied: 'In the empire's commands, is Qi predictable? Qi attacks Song knowing it serves Qin to aid itself with a ten-thousand chariot kingdom; if it does not serve Qin to the west, Song's governance will not be peaceful. The white-haired wandering persuaders of China all accumulate wisdom desiring to separate Qi and Qin's alliance; those hiding crossbows and tying letters galloping west have not one speaking well of Qi; those hiding crossbows and tying letters galloping east have not one speaking well of Qin. Why? All do not desire Qi and Qin's union. How wise are Jin and Chu, how foolish Qi and Qin! When Jin and Chu unite they must plot against Qi and Qin; when Qi and Qin unite they must scheme against Jin and Chu. Please decide affairs with this.' The Qin king said: 'Agreed.' Then Qi proceeded to attack Song; the Song king fled and died at Wen. Qi carved south from Chu the north of Huai, invaded west the three Jin, desiring to annex Zhou and become Son of Heaven. The feudal lords of Zou and Lu above the Si all styled themselves ministers; the feudal lords were fearful.

sentences.zh: 三十九年，秦來伐，拔我列城九。

translations.literal: In the thirty-ninth year, Qin came to attack and captured nine of our cities in succession.

sentences.zh: 四十年，燕、秦、楚、三晉合謀，各出銳師以伐，敗我濟西。
王解而卻。
燕將樂毅遂入臨淄，盡取齊之寶藏器。
湣王出亡，之衛。
衛君辟宮捨之，稱臣而共具。
湣王不遜，衛人侵之。
湣王去，走鄒、魯，有驕色，鄒、魯君弗內，遂走莒。
楚使淖齒將兵救齊，因相齊湣王。
淖齒遂殺湣王而與燕共分齊之侵地鹵器。

translations.literal: In the fortieth year, Yan, Qin, Chu, and the three Jin conspired, each sending elite troops to attack, defeating us at Jixi. The king untied his hair and retreated. Yan general Yue Yi then entered Linzi and took all Qi's treasure stores and vessels. King Min fled to Wei. The Wei lord cleared a palace to house him, styled himself minister and provided supplies together. King Min was not deferential, and Wei people invaded him. King Min departed, fleeing to Zou and Lu, showing arrogant bearing; the Zou and Lu lords would not admit him, so he fled to Ju. Chu sent Nao Chi to lead troops to save Qi, and he became chancellor to Qi's King Min. Nao Chi then killed King Min and together with Yan divided Qi's invaded lands and booty.

sentences.zh: 湣王之遇殺，其子法章變名姓為莒太史敫家庸。
太史敫女奇法章狀貌，以為非恒人，憐而常竊衣食之，而與私通焉。
淖齒既以去莒，莒中人及齊亡臣相聚求湣王子，欲立之。
法章懼其誅己也，久之，乃敢自言「我湣王子也」。
於是莒人共立法章，是為襄王。
以保莒城而布告齊國中：「王已立在莒矣。」

translations.literal: When King Min met his death, his son Fa Zhang changed his name and surname to become a hired laborer in the household of Ju's Grand Historian Jiao. Grand Historian Jiao's daughter was amazed by Fa Zhang's appearance and bearing, considering him no ordinary person, pitied him and constantly stole clothes and food for him, and had illicit relations with him. After Nao Chi departed Ju, the people of Ju and Qi's exiled ministers gathered together seeking King Min's son, desiring to establish him. Fa Zhang feared they would execute him, and after a long time dared to speak himself: 'I am King Min's son.' Then the Ju people together established Fa Zhang, who became King Xiang. To defend Ju city they proclaimed throughout Qi: 'The king has already been established in Ju.'

sentences.zh: 襄王既立，立太史氏女為王后，是為君王后，生子建。
太史敫曰：「女不取媒因自嫁，非吾種也，汙吾世。」
終身不睹君王后。
君王后賢，不以不睹故失人子之禮。

translations.literal: Once King Xiang was established, he made the Grand Historian's daughter queen, who became Queen Jun, and she bore a son Jian. Grand Historian Jiao said: 'The girl took no matchmaker but married herself; she is not of my seed and defiles my lineage.' His whole life he did not see Queen Jun. Queen Jun was worthy and did not lose the rites of a filial child because of not being seen.

sentences.zh: 襄王在莒五年，田單以即墨攻破燕軍，迎襄王於莒，入臨菑。
齊故地盡復屬齊。
齊封田單為安平君。

translations.literal: King Xiang was in Ju for five years when Tian Dan attacked and broke the Yan army from Jimo, welcomed King Xiang from Ju, and entered Linzi. All Qi's old lands again belonged to Qi. Qi enfeoffed Tian Dan as Lord of Anping.

sentences.zh: 十四年，秦擊我剛壽。
十九年，襄王卒，子建立。

translations.literal: In the fourteenth year, Qin attacked our Gangshou. In the nineteenth year, King Xiang died, and his son Jian ascended.

sentences.zh: 王建立六年，秦攻趙，齊楚救之。
秦計曰：「齊楚救趙，親則退兵，不親遂攻之。」
趙無食，請粟於齊，齊不聽。
周子曰：「不如聽之以退秦兵，不聽則秦兵不卻，是秦之計中而齊楚之計過也。
且趙之於齊楚，捍蔽也，猶齒之有脣也，脣亡則齒寒。
今日亡趙，明日患及齊楚。
且救趙之務，宜若奉漏甕沃焦釜也。
夫救趙，高義也；
卻秦兵，顯名也。
義救亡國，威卻彊秦之兵，不務為此而務愛粟，為國計者過矣。」
齊王弗聽。
秦破趙於長平四十餘萬，遂圍邯鄲。

translations.literal: In the sixth year of King Jian's establishment, Qin attacked Zhao, and Qi and Chu saved them. Qin planned: 'If Qi and Chu save Zhao with close alliance, then withdraw troops; if not close, then attack them.' Zhao had no food and requested grain from Qi, but Qi would not listen. Master Zhou said: 'It would be better to listen and use it to withdraw Qin troops; if not listen then Qin troops will not withdraw—this fulfills Qin's plan but misses Qi and Chu's strategy. Moreover, Zhao is a bulwark for Qi and Chu, like teeth having lips; if lips perish then teeth are cold. If today Zhao perishes, tomorrow calamity reaches Qi and Chu. Moreover, the task of saving Zhao should be like carrying a leaking urn to water a scorched cauldron. For saving Zhao is lofty righteousness; Driving back Qin troops brings illustrious name. Righteously saving a perishing kingdom, awesomely driving back strong Qin's troops—not pursuing this but loving grain, the national strategists have erred.' The Qi king would not listen. Qin broke Zhao at Changping with over four hundred thousand, then besieged Handan.

sentences.zh: 十六年，秦滅周。
君王后卒。
二十三年，秦置東郡。
二十八年，王入朝秦，秦王政置酒咸陽。
三十五年，秦滅韓。
三十七年，秦滅趙。
三十八年，燕使荊軻刺秦王，秦王覺，殺軻。
明年，秦破燕，燕王亡走遼東。
明年，秦滅魏，秦兵次於歷下。
四十二年，秦滅楚。
明年，虜代王嘉，滅燕王喜。

translations.literal: In the sixteenth year, Qin extinguished Zhou. Queen Jun died. In the twenty-third year, Qin established Dong commandery. In the twenty-eighth year, the king entered to court Qin, and Qin King Zheng hosted a banquet at Xianyang. In the thirty-fifth year, Qin extinguished Han. In the thirty-seventh year, Qin extinguished Zhao. In the thirty-eighth year, Yan sent Jing Ke to assassinate the Qin king; the Qin king became aware and killed Ke. The next year, Qin broke Yan, and the Yan king fled to Liaodong. The next year, Qin extinguished Wei, and Qin troops halted at Lixia. In the forty-second year, Qin extinguished Chu. The next year, they captured King Jia of Dai and extinguished King Xi of Yan.

sentences.zh: 四十四年，秦兵擊齊。
齊王聽相后勝計，不戰，以兵降秦。
秦虜王建，遷之共。
遂滅齊為郡。
天下壹并於秦，秦王政立號為皇帝。
始，君王后賢，事秦謹，與諸侯信，齊亦東邊海上，秦日夜攻三晉、燕、楚，五國各自救於秦，以故王建立四十餘年不受兵。
君王后死，后勝相齊，多受秦閒金，多使賓客入秦，秦又多予金，客皆為反閒，勸王去從朝秦，不修攻戰之備，不助五國攻秦，秦以故得滅五國。
五國已亡，秦兵卒入臨淄，民莫敢格者。
王建遂降，遷於共。
故齊人怨王建不蚤與諸侯合從攻秦，聽姦臣賓客以亡其國，歌之曰：「松耶柏耶？
住建共者客耶？」
疾建用客之不詳也。

translations.literal: In the forty-fourth year, Qin troops attacked Qi. The Qi king listened to Chancellor Hou Sheng's plan, did not fight, and surrendered troops to Qin. Qin captured King Jian and moved him to Gong. Thus extinguished Qi and made it a commandery. The empire was unified under Qin, and Qin King Zheng established the title of emperor. At first, Queen Jun was worthy, served Qin cautiously, was trustworthy with the feudal lords, and Qi was also bordered by the eastern sea; Qin attacked the three Jin, Yan, and Chu day and night, and the five kingdoms each defended themselves against Qin, which is why King Jian established himself for over forty years without suffering invasion. After Queen Jun died, Hou Sheng became Qi chancellor, received much Qin gold for espionage, sent many guests into Qin, and Qin gave much gold; the guests all became double agents, advising the king to abandon alliances and court Qin, not prepare for attack and battle, not help the five kingdoms attack Qin, which is why Qin was able to extinguish the five kingdoms. Once the five kingdoms had perished, Qin troops suddenly entered Linzi, and no people dared resist. King Jian then surrendered and was moved to Gong. Therefore Qi people resented King Jian for not early uniting with the feudal lords to attack Qin, listening to treacherous ministers and guests to lose his kingdom, and sang of it: 'Pine or cypress? The one dwelling with Jian in Gong is a guest?' Hating that Jian's use of guests was inauspicious.

sentences.zh: 太史公曰：蓋孔子晚而喜易。
易之為術，幽明遠矣，非通人達才孰能注意焉！
笔周太史之卦田敬仲完，占至十世之後；
及完奔齊，懿仲卜之亦云。
田乞及常所以比犯二君，專齊國之政，非必事勢之漸然也，蓋若遵厭兆祥云。

translations.literal: The Grand Historian says: Indeed, Confucius in his later years delighted in the Changes. The Changes as a discipline is profound and far-reaching; who but the perspicacious and accomplished can attend to it! When Zhou's Grand Historian divined for Tian Jingzhong Wan, he prognosticated to ten generations later; And when Wan fled to Qi, Yi Zhong divined it and it was the same. That Tian Qi and Chang were able to repeatedly offend two rulers and monopolize Qi's governance was not necessarily a gradual development of circumstances, but rather as if following the omens and portents.
